intro: Leucostele atacamensis, commonly known as the Atacama leucostele, is a rare plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the family Pteridaceae and is characterized by its unique leaf structure, which includes a specialized vascular system known as a leucostele. This plant exhibits a creeping growth habit with rhizomes and produces small, inconspicuous spores rather than seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural habitat.
